meanings.definition: Consisting of three pairs or sets.
meanings.sent1: The tractors were trijugate, each pulling three wagons.
meanings.sent2: The necklace had a trijugate design with three matching pendants.
meanings.sent3: The trampoline was trijugate, bouncing the friends in perfect sync.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the trijugate halls of the old mansion.
meanings.sent5: The trijugate pattern on the quilt made it a unique family heirloom.

meanings.definition: Divided into three parts or branches.
meanings.sent1: The river split into a trijugate delta before reaching the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The tree had a trijugate trunk, each branch growing in a different direction.
meanings.sent3: The trampoline was trijugate, bouncing the friends in perfect sync.
meanings.sent4: Her path in life seemed trijugate, leading her in three different directions.
meanings.sent5: The trijugate road sign pointed travelers to three different destinations.
